verses.roman:
etaj jñātvānaya kṣipraṁ
rāma-kṛṣṇāv ihārbhakau
dhanur-makha-nirīkṣārthaṁ
draṣṭuṁ yadu-pura-śriyam

synonyms: etat—this; jñātvā—knowing; ānaya—bring; kṣipram—quickly; rāma-kṛṣṇau—Rāma and Kṛṣṇa; arbhakau—the young boys; nirīkṣā-artham—in order to witness; draṣṭum—to see; yadu-pura—of the capital city of the Yadu dynasty; śriyam—the opulence.
translation: Now that you understand my intentions, please go at once and bring Kṛṣṇa and Balarāma to watch the bow sacrifice and see the opulence of the Yadus' capital.
